snippet: After a panel called for a “competitiveness shock,” the government said it would cut payroll taxes for businesses by $25.6 billion to help reduce labor costs.
abstract: Socialist government of French Pres Francois Hollande says it will cut payroll taxes for businesses by $25.6 billion over three years in response to calls to make French industry more competitive by reducing labor costs; stops short of adopting broader changes recommended by an expert panel that called for a 'competitive shock' to the French economy.
lead_paragraph: After a panel called for a “competitiveness shock,” the government said it would cut payroll taxes for businesses by $25.6 billion to help reduce labor costs.

headline.seo: France Announces Cut in Payroll Taxes for Businesses
headline.main: France Announces Cut in Payroll Taxes for Businesses
headline.print_headline: In France, An Effort To Compete
